trans-unit.source: Azure Mobile Engagement Android SDK Integration
trans-unit.target: Azure Mobile Engagement Android SDK Integration

trans-unit.source: Latest updates and procedures for Android SDK for Azure Mobile Engagement
trans-unit.target: Latest updates and procedures for Android SDK for Azure Mobile Engagement

trans-unit.source: If you already have integrated an older version of our SDK into your application, you have to consider the following points when upgrading the SDK.
trans-unit.target: If you already have integrated an older version of our SDK into your application, you have to consider the following points when upgrading the SDK.

trans-unit.source: You may have to follow several procedures if you missed several versions of the SDK.
trans-unit.target: You may have to follow several procedures if you missed several versions of the SDK.

trans-unit.source: For example if you migrate from 1.4.0 to 1.6.0 you have to first follow the "from 1.4.0 to 1.5.0" procedure then the "from 1.5.0 to 1.6.0" procedure.
trans-unit.target: For example if you migrate from 1.4.0 to 1.6.0 you have to first follow the "from 1.4.0 to 1.5.0" procedure then the "from 1.5.0 to 1.6.0" procedure.

trans-unit.source: Whatever the version you upgrade from, you have to replace the mobile-engagement-VERSION.jar with the new one.
trans-unit.target: Whatever the version you upgrade from, you have to replace the mobile-engagement-VERSION.jar with the new one.

trans-unit.source: The SDK now handle new permission model from Android M.
trans-unit.target: The SDK now handle new permission model from Android M.

trans-unit.source: If you use location features or big picture notifications please read <linkText>this section</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you use location features or big picture notifications please read <linkText>this section</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In addition to the new permission model, we now support configuring location features at runtime.
trans-unit.target: In addition to the new permission model, we now support configuring location features at runtime.

trans-unit.source: We are still compatible with the manifest parameters for location but it's now deprecated.
trans-unit.target: We are still compatible with the manifest parameters for location but it's now deprecated.

trans-unit.source: To use runtime configuration, remove the following sections from your AndroidManifest.xml:
trans-unit.target: To use runtime configuration, remove the following sections from your AndroidManifest.xml:

trans-unit.source: and read <linkText>this updated procedure</linkText><title></title> to use runtime configuration instead.
trans-unit.target: and read <linkText>this updated procedure</linkText><title></title> to use runtime configuration instead.

trans-unit.source: Native push (GCM/ADM) is now also used for in app notifications so you must configure the native push credentials for any type of push campaign.
trans-unit.target: Native push (GCM/ADM) is now also used for in app notifications so you must configure the native push credentials for any type of push campaign.

trans-unit.source: If not already done please follow <linkText>this procedure</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If not already done please follow <linkText>this procedure</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Reach integration has been modified in AndroidManifest.xml.
trans-unit.target: Reach integration has been modified in AndroidManifest.xml.

trans-unit.source: Replace this:
trans-unit.target: Replace this:

trans-unit.source: By
trans-unit.target: By

trans-unit.source: There is possibly a loading screen now when you click on an announcement (with text/web content) or a poll.
trans-unit.target: There is possibly a loading screen now when you click on an announcement (with text/web content) or a poll.

trans-unit.source: You have to add this for those campaigns to work in 4.0.0:
trans-unit.target: You have to add this for those campaigns to work in 4.0.0:

trans-unit.source: Embed the new res/layout/engagement_loading.xml file into your project.
trans-unit.target: Embed the new res/layout/engagement_loading.xml file into your project.

trans-unit.source: The following describes how to migrate an SDK integration from the Capptain service offered by Capptain SAS into an app powered by Azure Mobile Engagement.
trans-unit.target: The following describes how to migrate an SDK integration from the Capptain service offered by Capptain SAS into an app powered by Azure Mobile Engagement.

trans-unit.source: If you are migrating from an earlier version, please consult the Capptain web site to migrate to 2.4.0 first and then apply the following procedure.
trans-unit.target: If you are migrating from an earlier version, please consult the Capptain web site to migrate to 2.4.0 first and then apply the following procedure.

trans-unit.source: Capptain and Mobile Engagement are not the same services, and the procedure given below only highlights how to migrate the client app.
trans-unit.target: Capptain and Mobile Engagement are not the same services, and the procedure given below only highlights how to migrate the client app.

trans-unit.source: Migrating the SDK in the app will NOT migrate your data from the Capptain servers to the Mobile Engagement servers.
trans-unit.target: Migrating the SDK in the app will NOT migrate your data from the Capptain servers to the Mobile Engagement servers.

trans-unit.source: Replace capptain.jar by mobile-engagement-VERSION.jar in your libs folder.
trans-unit.target: Replace capptain.jar by mobile-engagement-VERSION.jar in your libs folder.

trans-unit.source: Every resource file that we provided (prefixed by capptain_) has to be replaced by the new ones (prefixed with engagement_).
trans-unit.target: Every resource file that we provided (prefixed by capptain_) has to be replaced by the new ones (prefixed with engagement_).

trans-unit.source: If you customized those files, you have to re-apply your customization on the new files, all the identifiers in the resource files have also been renamed.
trans-unit.target: If you customized those files, you have to re-apply your customization on the new files, all the identifiers in the resource files have also been renamed.

trans-unit.source: Now Engagement uses a connection string to configure the SDK identifiers such as the application identifier.
trans-unit.target: Now Engagement uses a connection string to configure the SDK identifiers such as the application identifier.

trans-unit.source: You have to use EngagementAgent.init method in your launcher activity like this:
trans-unit.target: You have to use EngagementAgent.init method in your launcher activity like this:

trans-unit.source: The connection string for your application is displayed on Azure Portal.
trans-unit.target: The connection string for your application is displayed on Azure Portal.

trans-unit.source: Please remove any call to CapptainAgent.configure as EngagementAgent.init replaces that method.
trans-unit.target: Please remove any call to CapptainAgent.configure as EngagementAgent.init replaces that method.

trans-unit.source: The appId can no longer be configured using AndroidManifest.xml.
trans-unit.target: The appId can no longer be configured using AndroidManifest.xml.

trans-unit.source: Please remove this section from your AndroidManifest.xml if you have it:
trans-unit.target: Please remove this section from your AndroidManifest.xml if you have it:

trans-unit.source: Every call to any Java class of our SDK has to be renamed; for example, CapptainAgent.getInstance(this) must be renamed EngagementAgent.getInstance(this), extends CapptainActivity must be renamed extends EngagementActivity etc...
trans-unit.target: Every call to any Java class of our SDK has to be renamed; for example, CapptainAgent.getInstance(this) must be renamed EngagementAgent.getInstance(this), extends CapptainActivity must be renamed extends EngagementActivity etc...

trans-unit.source: If you were integrated with default agent preference files, the default file name is now engagement.agent and the key is engagement:agent.
trans-unit.target: If you were integrated with default agent preference files, the default file name is now engagement.agent and the key is engagement:agent.

trans-unit.source: When creating web announcements, the Javascript binder is now engagementReachContent.
trans-unit.target: When creating web announcements, the Javascript binder is now engagementReachContent.

trans-unit.source: A lot of changes happened there, the service is not shared anymore, and a lot of receivers are not exportable anymore.
trans-unit.target: A lot of changes happened there, the service is not shared anymore, and a lot of receivers are not exportable anymore.

trans-unit.source: The service declaration is now simpler; remove the intent filter and all meta-data inside it, and add exportable=false.
trans-unit.target: The service declaration is now simpler; remove the intent filter and all meta-data inside it, and add exportable=false.

trans-unit.source: Plus everything is renamed to use engagement.
trans-unit.target: Plus everything is renamed to use engagement.

trans-unit.source: It now looks like:
trans-unit.target: It now looks like:

trans-unit.source: When you want to enable test logs, the meta-data has now been moved to the application tag and has been renamed:
trans-unit.target: When you want to enable test logs, the meta-data has now been moved to the application tag and has been renamed:

trans-unit.source: All other meta-data have just been renamed, here is the full list (of course rename only the ones you use):
trans-unit.target: All other meta-data have just been renamed, here is the full list (of course rename only the ones you use):

trans-unit.source: Google Play and SmartAd tracking has been removed from SDK you just have to remove this without replacement:
trans-unit.target: Google Play and SmartAd tracking has been removed from SDK you just have to remove this without replacement:

trans-unit.source: The Reach activities are now declared like this:
trans-unit.target: The Reach activities are now declared like this:

trans-unit.source: If you have custom Reach activities, you need only to change the intent actions to match either com.microsoft.azure.engagement.reach.intent.action.ANNOUNCEMENT or com.microsoft.azure.engagement.reach.intent.action.POLL.
trans-unit.target: If you have custom Reach activities, you need only to change the intent actions to match either com.microsoft.azure.engagement.reach.intent.action.ANNOUNCEMENT or com.microsoft.azure.engagement.reach.intent.action.POLL.

trans-unit.source: The broadcast receivers have been renamed, plus we now add exported=false.
trans-unit.target: The broadcast receivers have been renamed, plus we now add exported=false.

trans-unit.source: Here is the full list of the receivers with the new specification, (of course rename only the ones you use):
trans-unit.target: Here is the full list of the receivers with the new specification, (of course rename only the ones you use):

trans-unit.source: Tracking receiver has been removed, so you have to remove this section:
trans-unit.target: Tracking receiver has been removed, so you have to remove this section:

trans-unit.source: Note that the declaration of your implementation of the broadcast receiver EngagementMessageReceiver has changed in the AndroidManifest.xml.
trans-unit.target: Note that the declaration of your implementation of the broadcast receiver EngagementMessageReceiver has changed in the AndroidManifest.xml.

trans-unit.source: This is because the API to send and remove arbitrary XMPP messages from arbitrary XMPP entities and the API to send and receive messages between devices have been removed.
trans-unit.target: This is because the API to send and remove arbitrary XMPP messages from arbitrary XMPP entities and the API to send and receive messages between devices have been removed.

trans-unit.source: Thus, you have also to delete the following callbacks from your EngagementMessageReceiver implementation :
trans-unit.target: Thus, you have also to delete the following callbacks from your EngagementMessageReceiver implementation :

trans-unit.source: and
trans-unit.target: and

trans-unit.source: then delete any call on EngagementAgent for :
trans-unit.target: then delete any call on EngagementAgent for :

trans-unit.source: and
trans-unit.target: and

trans-unit.source: Proguard configuration can be impacted by rebranding, the rules are now looking like:
trans-unit.target: Proguard configuration can be impacted by rebranding, the rules are now looking like:
